intro: Urostachys erectus, commonly known as the upright spurge, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or herb, with narrow, upright leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in small cyathia, which are specialized structures typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Urostachys erectus is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, often thriving in rocky or sandy soils.
